article: After listening to everyone's concerns and problems, Professor Smith looked over at the hostess and asked her if she could get a paper and pen for everyone in the room. She _ a minute later, and brought some paper and pens. "Do me a _ ," Professor Smith asked. "We're going to try something and I _ your cooperation. On the small piece of paper please write down the 3 biggest problems you are facing in your personal life right now. Don't write your name on it. We'll keep it _ ." The group found the experiment _ , not knowing what was to follow. After everyone wrote down their problems, Professor Smith asked everyone to _ their paper and put it in a small basket that was in the front of the room. There were _ expressions throughout the room, _ again, everyone cooperated, wanting to know what would _ next. Professor Smith shook the basket and then he _ around the room and asked each person to _ a paper from the basket. After he had done that, he sat back down and looked around the room. "Friends, _ the paper and read to yourself the problems that you _ ," Professor Smith said. Then, Professor Smith _ at the woman sitting on his left and asked, "Lisa, would you like to _ your problems that you wrote down with those that you chose from the basket?" "No," Lisa said. Next, Professor Smith asked the man sitting next to Lisa the _ question. "Would you like to exchange the problems you wrote down with those that you chose from the basket?" _ the reply was "No." Professor Smith went around the whole room. Everyone had a _ to answer. Surprisingly, the answers were all the same -- no, no, no, no.... Some people said that "I can settle my own problems, but I can't deal with what I chose out of the basket". Some people said "Wow -- these make my problems look like nothing."
